title: Restore successful deploy by aligning frontend type bindings with backend Candid interface

requirements.summary: Ensure the frontend builds cleanly after backend fixes by updating/regenerating TypeScript bindings so hooks can call all required backend methods.
acceptanceCriteria: A clean build and deploy completes successfully (backend + frontend).

The frontend compiles successfully with TypeScript and can call the backend methods used in frontend/src/hooks/useQueries.ts (e.g., submitInviteRequest, checkInviteStatus, getAllInviteRequests, getAllManagers, approveInvite, rejectInvite, addManager, removeManager).

file_operations.description: Update the generated/declared backend type bindings to exactly match the backend Candid interface after the Motoko compilation fixes, ensuring all methods used by the app are present with correct parameter/return types (including any actor-initialization method invoked by the frontend such as _initializeAccessControlWithSecret if it exists in the generated actor).

Align actor initialization and typing with the updated backend bindings so TypeScript compiles cleanly (e.g., ensure any access-control initialization call is typed and compatible with the regenerated backend interface).
Reconcile React Query hooks with the updated backend bindings (method names/signatures/types) so all required calls compile and remain functional without changing UX flows.
